name: Melia Peninsula Varadero

reviews.text: Stayed at Tryp Peninsula from Jan 20th -27th rated 5 star sb only a 2 star. So i have been to CUBA before and yes the food is always a big part of the rating but as much as you here that the food is not great you will always find something to eat. At TRYP you will not find any service you can wait at the lobby bar and restaurant buffet for a very long time before you are asked if you would like something to DRINK than once ordered you will have to wait even longer to get it if in the end you do get it. We have sat through dinner with no drinks and I had to go to the bar to order and get our own drinks. Lets talk about the BUFFET and their DIRTY DISHES and not one you can take dish after dish and they would be all dirty. The service is EXTREMELY SLOWWWW and lacking in CUSTOMER SERVICE. II would not reccomend this Hotel at any COST and beleive me I would NEVER GO BACK. As far as ENTERTAINMENT there is no entertainment you get a half an hour show at night and at 10:30pm you'll call it a night. If you are looking for movement, service and a memberable time Iberostar is your BEST BET trust me. The grounds are kept clean and so are the rooms but for the rest of the RESORT 2 STAR AT ITS BEST.
reviews.title: WHERE'S THE SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first vacation in Cuba. We stayed at the Tryp Peninsula, and it is a wonderful resort.
reviews.title: Had an amazing vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds
reviews.title: Great Value make for a great trip

reviews.text: The grounds were beautiful and extremely well kept, thanks to the hard work of the many gardeners. They work very hard, but always have time for a friendly smile and an "Hola".
reviews.title: a great trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Great Vacation
Decent hotel
reviews.text: We just got back from a week at Tryp Peninsula. Essentially, the reason we went was the stunning beach, which was clean, spacious, and even more beautiful in real life. It definitely did not disappoint. The hotel itself was staffed with some of the most friendly, hard-working group of people i have encountered. Despite the size of the grounds, and the hundreds upon hundreds of guests, general cleanliness was well-maintained by the gardeners, chambermaids, etc. who seemed to work around the clock.

That said, an area which i think needs major improvement is the food. I appreciate that Cuba has limited ingredients and makes do with what is available, however the food at this hotel simply was no good. It was bland and either over or under-cooked. Add to that the abundance flies hovering over the food and around the restaurant, and it makes for a quite appetite-suppressing experience.
reviews.title: A hell for non-smokers and kids

reviews.text: Lastly, i recommend exchanging your cash all at one time because the line-up can get extremely long due to the slow service and difficult guests. It seems the clerk, who is encased in a tiny room behind a glass window, was unable to cope with pressure of the sheer volume of people. I felt bad for her. The hotel should hire a second employee to help her out.
reviews.title: Tryp Varadero Cuba 2012

reviews.text: All in all, you will get your money's worth at this resort, if you know what to expect. Do not make the mistake of comparing different international standards.
reviews.title: January 2012

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is OK, may be 3.5 stars.
reviews.title: TRYP 2012

reviews.text: I too stayed in Villa 17, second floor, in my opinion a good central location to the pool, beach and restaurants. I echo the comments of the persons below...good value, and good(for Cuba) food. A couple of minor areas could use improvement....at $10 per hour the internet was unbelievably slow....I have used the net from Afghanistan and it was a lot quicker. A la cartes were OK....the amount of salt used the first night in the Japanese one was too much, though it improved my second visit. And the Mexican one, excellent string music the first night...absent the second :(. And the desserts offered, do not take the fruit salad, it was canned complete with little red cherry like you used to eat as a kid. I doubt that is considered gourmet in Mexico either. You would think that with all the fruit available, and rum, they could do something up that was fresh and delish with little effort. Food generally OK, I prefered salad at lunch, and did not notice the lines being overly long. Michael the bartender in the island gazebo excellent...on his day off I did not appreciate being told to fetch my own beer by some replacement bar server, and then had to go through the hassle of explaining to the lobby bar staff I was not going to run off with their glassware out of the immediate area. Buying a visitors pass to the vip lounge in Varadero airport on departure was well worth the $23 IMHO, the departure area upstairs was a zoo, and you get priority through the exit payment area as well. I saw two skeeters in two weeks, and one big beetle crawling across my room floor as I had left the door open; he had expired on the dressing room floor by the next morning. Had a good day on side trip to Havana, and would like to rtn there next time for a few days.
reviews.title: Two Week Stay 5-19 Jan 12

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for 4 days early January 2012. Booking in was easy, we had no wait whatsoever, and when we asked about our room we were told it was on third floor before we could ask for that. One star.
reviews.title: Nice place, pretty good, and the beach unrivaled to take long walks.

reviews.text: Resort grounds are large and we were driven to our room in a little golfcart type vehicle. Our villa (cottage 17) was halfway between lobby and beach, nicely tucked away from both the entertainments and the pool and beach day "entertainment" - read loud boom boom type animation. Which was also nice. Another star.
reviews.title: Great vacation!

reviews.text: The room was confortable, large, with a nice bathroom. We had, like other traveller's commented, some mishaps (coffee filter missing is an example) but we find these little quirks part of the travel experience and hey, nothing to brag about.
reviews.title: AVERAGE OVERATED

reviews.text: Being there for 4 nights we had only one à la carte meal and we chose the mexican restaurant. We were not deceived, surprising presentation and quality food, good efficient service and live musicians.
reviews.title: Great vacation, we relaxed and got happy

reviews.text: My family and I(woman aged 24 and mom, dad and brother aged 17) stayed at the Tryp from December 20-27th. This was our first holiday over Christmas and had a great time.
reviews.title: Never wanted to leave :(

reviews.text: The resort was pretty large, having to walk a lot to get anywhere but that didn't bother us as we love to walk. The resort grounds were very beautiful and kept up really well.
reviews.title: will not go back to cuba.....

reviews.text: After reading some ratings I was a bit concerned coming to this resort, but after staying there I was wondering how all of these people had bad experiences. We had two rooms that were side by side on the 3rd floor in 19 block. When we arrived at the resort, check in was very quick and smooth and we got our rooms right away. My brother and I's room had no problems at all, very clean and pretty big. The beds ok were a bit hard but that didn't bother us at all. My parent's room had some problems. Their t.v. didn't work at all so they called down to the front desk and they had a man come and fix it. They only waited like 10 minutes for someone to come and give them a new t.v. On the third day the safe wouldn't open. All of our money and passports were stuck in there so they called again and someone within 10-15 minutes came and solved the problem. Our maid was pretty good, we had to tip her to do a good job but I expect to tip. They only leave you one cola, one bottle of water and one beer per day so you might have to buy some more at the gift shop. This wasn't a big issue because beer, pop and water is really cheap in Cuba, especially their awesome rum :)
reviews.title: Very happy once agian

reviews.text: I found the Cuban workers amazing. They always had smiles on their faces and said hi all the time. My dad and I loved Vladimir at the pool bar! He always kept us entertained. I will definetly be coming back to Cuba just because the Cuban people are awesome.
reviews.title: Great family vacation with no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was amazing. Pretty white sand, beautiful blue/green water and very clean. We never had a problem finding beach chairs. We thought that over Christmas it might be really busy but there never seemed to be a lot of people anywhere we went. The pool was really cold, but that never bothered us since it was really hot during our week so it was very refreshing to swim in the pool.
reviews.title: All-inclusive first timer

description: All inclusive resort ideal for families, with a dedicated children's area, a marvelous tranquil beach, full of activities for all ages. Honeymooners also get special treatment in a quiet special area. Tennis courts, gym, non motorized water sports, drinks, a la carte and buffet dining included.
